page.title: 10CSOS Morwenstow
page.content: Composite Signals Organisation Station Morwenstow is a Civil Service department and a 'Government station for research into satellite communications'. It occupies crown land on what was formerly Cleave farm and was purchased in 1939 for use by the army and later RAF to train anti-aircraft gunners. The present station was begun with the erection of two 150 feet high dish antennas. It became operational in 1971/2 and has since extended the complex to occupy an 80 acre site with 7 variously sized antennas and two more planned. Besides being a major landmark and tourist attraction, CSOS provides some employment for the indigenous population, contributes greatly to the parish rates and ensures access to the A39 is maintained during winter weather.
